Class BlackJackHand

java.lang.Object
  BlackJackHand

public class BlackJackHand
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a black jack hand, which contains two or more Cards.

Constructor Summary

          The constructor to accept the starting two Cards for this BlackJackHand.

Constructor Detail

BlackJackHand

public BlackJackHand(Card card1,
                     Card card2)
The constructor to accept the starting two Cards for this BlackJackHand. If one of the Cards is an ace, this BlackJackHand is soft.

Method Detail

canSplit

public boolean canSplit()
This method determines whether the BlackJackHand can be split or not. In order qualify for a possible split, the BlackJackHand can only have two Cards, and they must have the same value.

split

public BlackJackHand[] split(Card card1,
                             Card card2)
If the BlackJackHand can be split, this method will split the BlackJackHand. The two Cards in the current BlackJackHand become one Card each for two new BlackJackHands. The next two Cards for the two new BlackJackHands are passed in as parameters.

isDouble

public boolean isDouble()
Returns true if this BlackJackHand has been doubled, and false otherwise.

doubled

public void doubled()
Sets this BlackJackHand as having been doubled.

hit

public int hit(Card card)
Hits this BlackJackHand by adding the Card passed in to the ArrayList storing the Cards in this BlackJackHand.

size

public int size()
Returns the number of Cards in this BlackJackHand.

isSoft

public boolean isSoft()
Returns true if this BlackJackHand is soft, and false otherwise.

handValue

public int handValue()
Computes the value of this BlackJackHand. Determines whether this BlackJackHand is soft or not using both totals returned from the helper sum method. If the second total is greater than 21, the first total is used and this BlackJackHand is not soft. If the second total is less than 21 but the second total and the first total are the same, either total is used and this BlackJackHand is not soft. Otherwise, the second total is used and this BlackJackHand is soft.

upCard

public int upCard()
Returns the value of the first Card in the ArrayList in case this BlackJackHand is the dealer's hand.

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 boolean upCard)
Draws this BlackJackHand to the screen.
